habitat_description:
The spotted chirping frog is found in the Big Bend region of south Texas in Brewster, Presidio, and Pecos counties; its range extends from there southward into Nuevo León, Coahuila, San Luis Potosí, and Guanajuato (Dixon 2000; Lanoo 2005). 
Habitat of preference of this species occurs in areas vegetated by oak and pine, but also occupies caves, canyons, springs, and ravines. This species is known to burrow and hide under rocks and leaf litter (Natureserve.org). Other occurrences have been reported in rocky outcrops, bluffs, and in man-made rock walls, while in lower elevations this species is found along road cuts, limestone bluffs, and mines along the Rio Grande (Green et al. 2014).

Vegetation cover of preference is associated with pine-oak forests.
